title: Poster, "Crossing the Line – FIAF Fall Festival", 2010
description: Poster featuring the repeating text "CROSSING THE LINE" in white letterforms composed with computer-generated punctuation marks.  "FIAF/ FALL/ FSTVL," SEPT/ 10-27/ 2010" and "fi:af french institute/ alliance française" printed in yellow against black background.
justification: For this 2010 poster designed to advertise the annual interdisciplinary fall festival of French Institute Alliance Française (FIAF) in New York, Apeloig employs the same fundamental typographic design that he used in his poster of several years earlier, Vivo in Typo.&nbsp; Here, however, Apeloig transforms the font by once again manipulating the spacing of computer-generated punctuation to create text forms of varying density.&nbsp; Apeloig riffs off of the movement implied in the title of the festival, Crossing The Line, repeating the phrase over and over again across the space of the poster.&nbsp; As the eye moves from left to right, the individual text forms appear to break apart or fade into the distance.&nbsp; This poster was included in the 2012 exhibition Graphic Design: Now in Production.&nbsp;

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, "Crossing the Line – FIAF Fall Festival", 2010.Screenprint. Gift of Philippe Apeloig. 2013-16-4.
